feed.title: NewsTracker: hillary clinton
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Hillary Clinton to testify before Benghazi panel in October: campaign
entry.summary: WASHINGTON -- Hillary Rodham Clinton will testify Oct. 22 before the House committee investigating the deaths of four Americans in the 2012 attacks in Benghazi, Libya, her presidential campaign said Saturday.

entry.title: Latest claim about Clinton's email server adds to furor
entry.summary: Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Rodham Clinton delivers a speech, Friday, July 24, 2015, at the New York University Leonard N. Stern School of Business in New York.

entry.title: Hillary Rodham Clinton Emails Wanted for Justice Probe, Sources Say
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - Two independent government investigators have asked the Justice Department to look into whether sensitive government information was transmitted through Hillary Rodham Clinton's personal email server, federal officials said Friday.

entry.title: U.S. Justice Dept asked to probe Hillary Clinton's email use: Report
entry.summary: NEW YORK - The U.S. Justice Department is weighing a request by two government inspectors general to open a criminal investigation into Hillary Clinton's use of a private email account for her work as secretary of state, the New York Times reported on Thursday.

entry.title: Clinton stops for soup, cobbler ahead of Michigan fundraiser
entry.summary:
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton laughs Tuesday, July 21, 2015 at Sweet Potato Sensations bake shop in Detroit.

Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton has stopped for some soup and sweet potato cobbler in Detroit ahead of a $2,700-a-head fundraiser in the suburbs.

Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton visits with Dawn Ray, owner of Simply Divine Gourmet Bakery in Detroit on Tuesday, July 21, 2015.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton on racial justice: 'Black lives matter'
Jeb Bush's Uber driver would vote for Hillary Clinton
Hillary Clinton returns to Arkansas, now behind GOP lines
entry.summary:
Headlining this year's event, presidential hopeful Clinton returns to a state that looks dramatically different than the one where she served as first lady for a dozen years.

As she ramps up her presidential campaign, Hillary Rodham Clinton is returning this weekend to a state that's part of her home territory - a place she's so well known her name adorns landmarks including the national airport and a children's library.

entry.title: Democratic activists still not quite ready for Clinton
entry.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton listens to a question from a guest after a town hall meeting in Dover, N.H., Thursday, July 16, 2015.

entry.title: Democratic activists still not quite ready for Hillary Clinton's 2016 bid
entry.summary: PHOENIX - Three months into Hillary Rodham Clinton's campaign for president, there are fresh warning signs she may be falling short with some Democratic voters whose enthusiasm will be essential to her success in 2016.

entry.title: Clinton proposes tax breaks for corporate profit-sharing
entry.summary:
DOVER, N.H. (AP) - Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton proposed new incentives Thursday to encourage corporations to share profits with workers.

Clinton's "Rising Incomes, Sharing Profits" plan is part of an economic platform she unveiled this week that focused on boosting wages for middle class families.

entry.title: Clinton proposes tax breaks for corporate profit-sharing
Hillary Clinton's standing falls among Democrats: poll
entry.summary: Hillary Clinton's standing is falling among Democrats, and voters view her as less decisive and inspiring than when she launched her presidential campaign just three months ago, according to a new Associated Press-GfK poll.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton spends $18 million, hires hundreds
entry.summary: Hillary Rodham Clinton spent more than $18 million and hired hundreds of employees in the first three months of her presidential campaign, creating a national operation that vastly outpaces her rivals in both parties.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton spends $19 million, hires hundreds
Hillary Clinton spends $19 million, hires hundreds
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - Hillary Rodham Clinton has spent nearly $19 million and has hired hundreds of staff during the first three months of her presidential campaign.

entry.title: Report: Clinton has spent 40% of campaign funds
entry.summary: Clinton campaign manager Robby Mook said thanks to their 250,000 donors, the campaign has "had the ability to make critical investments in our organization that will put us in position to win the primary and the White House."

entry.title: Clinton backs Iran nuclear agreement as 'important step'
entry.summary:
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton walks with House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi of Calif. on Capitol Hill in Washington, Tuesday, July 14, 2015.

Hillary Rodham Clinton praised the nuclear deal with Iran on Tuesday as an "important step," saying the agreement would end up "putting the lid on Iran's nuclear program."

entry.title: Hillary Clinton Slams Donald Trump in Spanish: ‘Basta!’
entry.summary: Hillary Clinton Slams Donald Trump in Spanish: 'Basta!'

entry.title: American Federation of Teachers endorses Hillary Clinton
entry.summary: "Hillary Clinton is a tested leader who shares our values, is supported by our members, and is prepared for a tough fight on behalf of students, families and communities."

entry.title: American Federation of Teachers endorses Hillary Clinton
entry.summary: "In vision, in experience and in leadership, Hillary Clinton is the champion working families need in the White House," AFT President Randi Weingarten said in a statement.

entry.title: American Federation of Teachers Endorses Hillary Clinton
Teachers' union endorses Clinton's 2016 presidential bid
Hillary Clinton to center campaign on raising middle-class incomes
entry.summary: Clinton plans to make boosting middle-class incomes and wages the focus of her presidential campaign's economic agenda.

entry.title: Clinton to outline steps to bolster middle class income in campaign economic speech on Monday
Hillary Clinton to Outline Economic Policy on Monday
Hillary Clinton advocates bankruptcy filing for Puerto Rico
Benghazi panel chair: Clinton subpoena claim inaccurate
entry.summary: Gowdy said the committee issued the March 4 subpoena to Clinton personally after learning the full extent of her use of private emails while serving as secretary of state.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton: 'People should and do trust me'
CNN to interview Hillary Clinton about her 2016 presidential campaign
China downplays Hillary Clinton’s claim it hacked U.S. information
Hillary Clinton, Ellen DeGeneres offer online support for gay child
entry.summary: Hillary Clinton and Ellen DeGeneres have come to the support of a young boy online, after he expressed fears for his future due to his homosexuality in a comment to a popular New York social media site.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton accuses China of trying to 'hack into everything that doesn't move in America'
entry.summary: US Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton accused China on Saturday of stealing commercial secrets and "huge amounts of government information," and of trying to "hack into everything that doesn't move in America."

entry.title: Hillary Clinton accuses China of hacking U.S. computers
entry.summary: Clinton said she hoped that "a strong verifiable deal" would be reached at talks in Vienna between world powers and Iran.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton: no substitute for 'constant engagement' with Putin
entry.summary: "That's why we have to be much smarter in how we deal with Putin and how we deal with his ambitions," Clinton said at a campaign event.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton’s emails reveal fax machine confusion
Emails show top U.S. officials knew about Hillary Clinton's private email address
entry.summary: Axelrod said Wednesday that while he knew Clinton had a private email address, "I did not know that she used it exclusively or that she had her server in her home."

entry.title: Hillary Clinton attends fundraiser in New Jersey
entry.summary: Hillary Clinton was in New Jersey raising money for her presidential campaign on the night before Gov. Chris Christie launches his presidential bid.
